intro: Wormskioldia schinzii, commonly known as the Cape mountain snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the high-altitude environments of the Western Cape. It has a compact, low-growing habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Wormskioldia schinzii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
